intro: Erythranthe bicolor, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or inland desert regions. Its leaves are linear and gray-green, while the stems are upright and branching. Erythranthe bicolor is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid environments.
